result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela R Sweet was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: May transfer probation to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

No Contact with any co-actors listed in the criminal complaint or with the Wal-Mart in Muskego. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To be completed as a condition of probation as directed by agent.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change. Terminated - regular
  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Angela R Sweet in court, in custody, with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Shannon Tenney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #6.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #6.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Weathers makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:  

COUNT #6:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

60 DAYS HUBER (CREDIT - _ days)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR   *Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  

____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: any Co-actors listed in criminal complaint or with Wal-Mart in Muskego
____20 Hours of Community Service

COSTS:  $253.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

*Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.*

CONDITION TIME:  15 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH     

***Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.***
